post.title: People that say Aliens won’t reveal themselves to us because we’re stupid are usually a bunch of fucking clowns themselves

body:
The actual answer is probably much simpler. We're an insignificant speck in a universe so vast even getting to us would be prohibitive in every way--time, distance, cost. We don't possess any resources that would attract an interstellar species, not when there are countless--probably closer--uninhabited planets with greater resources that haven't already been depleted by the natives (there are literally billions of stars and every star has at least 1 planet, and usually more). Any military action requires time, and a lot of money--an occupation, that far from known shipping lanes/supply lines, would cost even more time and money, and isn't worth the effort. And one forgets that the further away a star/solar system is, the further back into time it becomes. If there is/were a sentient, space faring species, they probably died out around the time of the dinosaurs, and by the time the could get to us, we will all be dead, so why bother? 

The light from a star you see today is already dead--like your dreams.
body_html:
The actual answer is probably much simpler. We're an insignificant speck in a universe so vast even getting to us would be prohibitive in every way--time, distance, cost. We don't possess any resources that would attract an interstellar species, not when there are countless--probably closer--uninhabited planets with greater resources that haven't already been depleted by the natives (there are literally billions of stars and every star has at least 1 planet, and usually more). Any military action requires time, and a lot of money--an occupation, that far from known shipping lanes/supply lines, would cost even more time and money, and isn't worth the effort. And one forgets that the further away a star/solar system is, the further back into time it becomes. If there is/were a sentient, space faring species, they probably died out around the time of the dinosaurs, and by the time the could get to us, we will all be dead, so why bother?

The light from a star you see today is already dead--like your dreams.

post.title: People that say Aliens won’t reveal themselves to us because we’re stupid are usually a bunch of fucking clowns themselves

body: I've always heard they're smarter than us. People never consider that it's entirely possible for aliens to possess similar intelligence to us and just in different stages of technology growth. Even if their own technology is useful to begin with besides their transportation hubs. We assume a lot about aliens but if we were to make contact with them in our lives we also have to consider that there's greater intelligence and lesser intelligence out there, too.
body_html: I've always heard they're smarter than us. People never consider that it's entirely possible for aliens to possess similar intelligence to us and just in different stages of technology growth. Even if their own technology is useful to begin with besides their transportation hubs. We assume a lot about aliens but if we were to make contact with them in our lives we also have to consider that there's greater intelligence and lesser intelligence out there, too.

body:
Reminds me of the fallout world. They had shitty TV screens, but advanced robotics. One minor change 50 years ago, could have our world looking completely different. An alien species would be even more different in terms of advancement. Imagine if they had a reason to need to suddenly get off of their planet. Putting 99% of technological development efforts into space travel would change everything. 

Hell, we'd have colonies on Mars right now if it weren't for a handful of laws in the U.S. in the last century. Or if slavery never happened.
body_html:
Reminds me of the fallout world. They had shitty TV screens, but advanced robotics. One minor change 50 years ago, could have our world looking completely different. An alien species would be even more different in terms of advancement. Imagine if they had a reason to need to suddenly get off of their planet. Putting 99% of technological development efforts into space travel would change everything.

Hell, we'd have colonies on Mars right now if it weren't for a handful of laws in the U.S. in the last century. Or if slavery never happened.

author.bio: The fire doesn't make you what you are; it reveals what you were

body:
The phrase "Humanity is not ready for the technology" - means they haven't found a way to monetize the technology, yet.


Tesla had wireless energy, cloning, and teleportation technology...and he wanted to give it to the world for FREE.  So they killed him and shut down his projects.
body_html:
The phrase "Humanity is not ready for the technology" - means they haven't found a way to monetize the technology, yet.

Tesla had wireless energy, cloning, and teleportation technology...and he wanted to give it to the world for FREE. So they killed him and shut down his projects.

body:
Y'all should watch this easy fun video about the great filter.  It talks a lot about the potential of aliens and why we may not have met them.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UjtOGPJ0URM&t=304s

My prevailing hypothesis is that the speed of light is a hard limit, and its way too slow.  We would never be able to visit each other and communication even would be rare and difficult.

Y'all should watch this easy fun video about the great filter. It talks a lot about the potential of aliens and why we may not have met them. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UjtOGPJ0URM&t=304s
